content:
• Friday, March 2, 2012
  • DISH

    Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) -3.5% AH after the FCC denies its request for a waiver needed to...

    Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) -3.5% AH after the FCC denies its request for a waiver needed to operate a planned 4G network, in-line with a Thursday report. CEO Charlie Ergen recently said Dish, which was given the go-ahead to buy spectrum from DBSD and TerreStar, would "look at other alternatives" if the FCC denied its request. Prospective suitor AT&T (NYSE:T) must be pleased.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP) -5.6% AH after filing to sell 23.5M shares (30% of all outstanding shares)...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP) -5.6% AH after filing to sell 23.5M shares (30% of all outstanding shares) held by money manager MHR Institutional Partners. MHR will have no stake in Leap following the sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp's (YELP +63.9%) first day of trading was a scorcher, but the question now is whether it...

    Yelp's (YELP +63.9%) first day of trading was a scorcher, but the question now is whether it proves sustainable. Anticipation of Facebook’s upcoming IPO is “casting a halo around yet another social media play,” one trader says. But other social media stocks that have gone public lately - LinkedIn is off 29% from its day-one peak - haven’t proven they can handle it. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 5 Comments
  • RMBS

    An ITC judge has ruled against Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) in a patent infringement claim filed against...

    An ITC judge has ruled against Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) in a patent infringement claim filed against LSI-OLD, STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM), and MediaTek, Bloomberg reports. Rambus has seen a string of legal setbacks (I, II, III) in recent months, though it received a positive ruling last week in a case against Hynix. Shares -1.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM

  • Flow International (FLOW -2.8%%) gives back all the days gains plus more despite beating FQ3...

    Flow International (FLOW -2.8%%) gives back all the days gains plus more despite beating FQ3 estimates yesterday. Profit more than doubled as the maker of water-jet machines saw continued strength in its standard segment, though its advanced segment continued to post lower sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • MYL

    Mylan (MYL -2.1%) trades lower thanks to an unfavorable ruling in its patent infringement suit...

    Mylan (MYL -2.1%) trades lower thanks to an unfavorable ruling in its patent infringement suit against Sunovion Pharmaceuticals related to its Brovana respiratory drug. A New York court granted a motion related to one of Sunovion's patent defenses, and also the company's request to limit damages. Mylan says it's appealing the ruling, and will continue to pursue an injunction.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • GA

    Chinese online gaming concern Giant Interactive (GA +6.4%) is upgraded to Buy with a price...

    Chinese online gaming concern Giant Interactive (GA +6.4%) is upgraded to Buy with a price target of $6 from $4 at Roth Capital, which anticipates more "solid" top-line growth and free cash flow in Monday's Q4 report while there's "decent upside potential" for a positive 2012 view on strength from new games.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • BANR

    Banner Corporation (BANR -2.8%) dips after being downgraded to Hold from Buy on valuation at...

    Banner Corporation (BANR -2.8%) dips after being downgraded to Hold from Buy on valuation at McAdams Wright. The stock has been on fire over the past few months, gaining over 76% since early October.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK -2.2%) has gained attention through cost cuts and asset sales, but Canaccord...

    Chesapeake (CHK -2.2%) has gained attention through cost cuts and asset sales, but Canaccord sees investor "misperception" that it has an inferior asset base, suggesting organic capital productivity is "~20% superior to the sector" and shifting resources to liquid energy as opposed to gas. CHK shares aren't helped today by the remarks, as energy stocks tumble in tandem with oil prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • APC

    Energy stocks outpace Wall Street's declines as losses in crude-oil futures stoke selling across...

    Energy stocks outpace Wall Street's declines as losses in crude-oil futures stoke selling across the sector: Anadarko Petroleum (APC -3.4%), Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -5.5%), Peabody Energy (BTU -6.1%), Murphy Oil (MUR -3.2%) and Cabot Oil & Gas (COG -4.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • GM

    GM will lay off 1.3K employees for 5 weeks at a Detroit plant as it temporarily halts production...

    GM will lay off 1.3K employees for 5 weeks at a Detroit plant as it temporarily halts production of the Chevy Volt amidst sputtering sales. Polypore International (PPO -2.1%) - a supplier to the automaker's battery cell supplier - tumbles on the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 72 Comments
  • ARCH

    Nomura comes out bearish on the U.S. coal sector, expecting "severe volume and price compression...

    Nomura comes out bearish on the U.S. coal sector, expecting "severe volume and price compression in lower-quality crossover coking coal during 2012, which should result in significant earnings declines as higher-priced contracts roll off." ACI -3.4% and PCX -4.7%, with significant exposure to this market, are labeled "high-conviction short ideas." Also lower: BTU -6%, ANR -5.5%, CNX -3.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 3 Comments
  • EPOC

    Epocrates (EPOC -11.2%) shares slide after the provider of medical information systems for...

    Epocrates (EPOC -11.2%) shares slide after the provider of medical information systems for physicians says it will abandon a planned move into electronic health records, and issues cautionary guidance for 2012. Eric Savitz sees EPOC's troubles as a cautionary tale for investors in Yelp and other hot IPOs: "Don’t confuse first day euphoria for an investment strategy."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • IDSY

    ID Systems (IDSY -8.4%) dips after posting a disappointing Q4. The company reported an EPS of...

    ID Systems (IDSY -8.4%) dips after posting a disappointing Q4. The company reported an EPS of $0.07 in line with Street estimates. Revenues came in short however, at $11.8M versus the expected $12M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • GNOM

    This afternoon's spike in shares of Complete Genomics (GNOM +7.1%) may be attributable to...

    This afternoon's spike in shares of Complete Genomics (GNOM +7.1%) may be attributable to remarks by CEO Cliff Reid on a recent paper that finds GNOM's whole genome sequencing service more accurate than Illumina's (ILMN +0.7%) HiSeq 2000 instrument. Reid says GNOM's sequencing produces 1/50th as many errors as ILMN's.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • CVC

    Cablevision (CVC +3.6%) director Rand Araskog bought 25,000 shares in the company this week for...

    Cablevision (CVC +3.6%) director Rand Araskog bought 25,000 shares in the company this week for about $356K, the first insider buy at the company in almost three years. Shares fell 9.7% on Tuesday after the company reported a 47% drop in profit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • FANH

    CNinsure (CISG -12.1%) drops after missing Q4 estimates. The China-based property and casualty...

    CNinsure (CISG -12.1%) drops after missing Q4 estimates. The China-based property and casualty insurer also reaffirmed less-than-stellar Q1 guidance, forecasting net revenue growth of less than 5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • PRTS

    Shares of online auto parts seller U.S. Auto Parts Network (PRTS -19%) plummet after reporting...

    Shares of online auto parts seller U.S. Auto Parts Network (PRTS -19%) plummet after reporting adjusted Q4 EPS of -$0.12 vs. analyst consensus of -$0.04. The adjusted EPS excludes a non-cash write-down of intangibles; Q4 revenues dropped 4.1% Y/Y. Roth Capital lowers shares to Neutral from Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +12.1%) goes on a run after the company announces initial production rates...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +12.1%) goes on a run after the company announces initial production rates at one of its Telemark wells in excess of 7K barrels per day. Shares are now up over 35% in the last month on a series of positive oil strikes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • AWK

    American Water Works (AWK -1.6%) dips after Baird downgrades the shares to Neutral from...

    American Water Works (AWK -1.6%) dips after Baird downgrades the shares to Neutral from Outperform on valuation. The stock has been a powerhouse, gaining over 33% since last August.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • LSTR

    Transportation logistics provider Landstar (LSTR -2.2%) heads lower after Stifel downgrades...

    Transportation logistics provider Landstar (LSTR -2.2%) heads lower after Stifel downgrades shares to Hold on valuation grounds. While noting recent management comments indicate Landstar is on track to meet 2012 EPS estimates, Stifel thinks the company's business model has little operating leverage, thus making EPS upside unlikely.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • FNSR

    Following a short-lived bounce yesterday off positive comments by Citigroup, shares of Finisar...

    Following a short-lived bounce yesterday off positive comments by Citigroup, shares of Finisar (FNSR -6%) resume their decline after issuing Q4 revenue guidance below analyst estimates on Wednesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -6.3%) is now off sharply on account of its Q4 warning, uncertain 2012...

    A123 Systems (AONE -6.3%) is now off sharply on account of its Q4 warning, uncertain 2012 guidance, and delayed 10-K filing. Likely playing a role is a downgrade to Underperform from BofA: the firm sees short-term risk rising due to cost overruns, cash burn, and a lack of visibility and transparency. It's also worried A123's electric car battery may develop slowly, and face intense competition.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • RCL

    Royal Caribbean (RCL -0.3%) files a registration statement with the SEC to sell a mix of...

    Royal Caribbean (RCL -0.3%) files a registration statement with the SEC to sell a mix of securities. After digging through the S-3, Nomura maintains a Buy rating, drawing the conclusion that the sale of shares by large stakeholders is tied to wealth management and not a change in sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • XLS

    ITT Exelis (XLS +4.5%) moves up after posting a mixed Q4 result that missed slightly on a per...

    ITT Exelis (XLS +4.5%) moves up after posting a mixed Q4 result that missed slightly on a per share basis but beat on revenue. Net earnings were higher, with stronger-than-anticipated top-line performance, driven largely its Information and Technical Services segment. The company also raises its guidance for 2012, now expecting sales of $5.4B - $5.5B and an EPS of $1.80 - $1.86.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears (SHLD) says that it will sell 3 stores to Canada's Cadillac Fairview for $172.3M as the...

    Sears (SHLD) says that it will sell 3 stores to Canada's Cadillac Fairview for $172.3M as the once-mighty retailer continues to look for spare change under the couch cushions. Shares are up 4.3% (naturally), as they continue their shorts-destroying 127% YTD runup.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 15 Comments
  • ATNI

    Atlantic Tele-Network (ATNI -5%) trades off after its Q4 results missed estimates late...

    Atlantic Tele-Network (ATNI -5%) trades off after its Q4 results missed estimates late yesterday. Total revenue declined 6% Y/Y, largely due to subscriber attrition following its Alltel acquisition. The telecommunications company notes that while it is encouraged by positive customer response to new value plans it launched during the period, there is room for improvement.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • HUSA

    Houston American Energy (HUSA +5.1%) gains on positive comments out of Canaccord, saying the...

    Houston American Energy (HUSA +5.1%) gains on positive comments out of Canaccord, saying the company plugged the lower portion of its Tamandua wellbore, with tests of additional zones to proceed shortly. The firm believes the well is not a failure and is cautiously optimistic that it may turn out to be a discovery in further testing. It reiterates a Speculative Buy with a $25 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • OSUR

    OraSure's (OSUR -2.3%) weakness creates buying opportunity, says ThinkEquity as the stock...

    OraSure's (OSUR -2.3%) weakness creates buying opportunity, says ThinkEquity as the stock continues to drop following its less-than-stellar Q4 results last month. The firm says it expects the company to have a "transformative year" in 2012 and recommends snapping up shares at current levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM

  • Crude oil continues to retreat, down nearly $4/barrel from yesterday's spike following the...

    Crude oil continues to retreat, down nearly $4/barrel from yesterday's spike following the (apparent) hoax of an attack and explosion at a Saudi pipeline. WTI crude (USO) -2.3% at $106.39. Brent crude (BNO) -2% at $123.70.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • WINT

    Today's drop in shares of Discovery Labs (DSCO -4.3%) reflects nervousness over next week's...

    Today's drop in shares of Discovery Labs (DSCO -4.3%) reflects nervousness over next week's expected FDA decision on Surfaxin, DSCO's drug for prevention of respiratory distress syndrome in premature infants. FDA Tracker is pessimistic about approval, saying DSCO won't be able to demonstrate bioequivalence since it changed the formulation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • MEET

    Quepasa (QPSA +12.8%) surges after reporting Q4 revenue of $11.9M (+96% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.12;...

    Quepasa (QPSA +12.8%) surges after reporting Q4 revenue of $11.9M (+96% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.12; the latter beat Street estimates by a penny. Quepasa, which owns a Latin American social networking site and myYearbook.com, says it ended the quarter with 78.1M registered users, up 5% Q/Q from Q3's 74.2M. Page views rose 12% Q/Q to 5.43B.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • BIG

    Big Lots (BIG -3.5%) dips after the company reports in line Q4 results but disappoints on Q1...

    Big Lots (BIG -3.5%) dips after the company reports in line Q4 results but disappoints on Q1 guidance. Net profit increased 4.2% Y/Y, as the closeout retailer posted better-than-expected revenue, but the company now says it only expects to earn between $0.75 - $0.81 per share, slightly below Street estimates of $0.81.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6%) resumes trading after this morning's shenanigans regarding its 8-K...

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6%) resumes trading after this morning's shenanigans regarding its 8-K filing. Following a sharp momentary drop, the shares return to near where they were previously. Pushing the send button on the filing may have been an error, but the fact that it was prepared may mean the deal is set to go.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • AIG

    AIG (AIG +0.2%) sold its $500M stake in PE firm Blackstone (BX -2.9%) through a block trade...

    AIG (AIG +0.2%) sold its $500M stake in PE firm Blackstone (BX -2.9%) through a block trade prior to today’s market open, CNBC reports. The sale is part of a capital raise for AIG, as it seeks to pay back the U.S. government from its 2008 bailout. BX has long been an adviser to AIG, but the sale marks building tensions between the two firms.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) falls 11.8% after the biotech firm files a 10-K with the SEC on the...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) falls 11.8% after the biotech firm files a 10-K with the SEC on the progress of its patents for AMR101 and the USPTO issues documents related to its "non-final" rejection of the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • WYNN

    The 8-K filing by Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6.3%) saying it had an agreement with Macau for land to...

    The 8-K filing by Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6.3%) saying it had an agreement with Macau for land to build another resort was a mistake and had not been authorized. "The Cotai Land Concession Contract has not been gazetted," reads the new 8-K. Shares remain halted.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • AMSF

    Shares of Amerisafe (AMSF +6.1%) kick up a gain after the provider of hazardous workers'...

    Shares of Amerisafe (AMSF +6.1%) kick up a gain after the provider of hazardous workers' compensation insurance reports Q4 revenue increased 17% Y/Y to $62.1M - helped along by a 19% jump in gross premiums written.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • BGCP

    The CNBC Effect? BGC Partners (BGCP +7.6%) trades higher after CEO Howard Lutnick sat down...

    The CNBC Effect? BGC Partners (BGCP +7.6%) trades higher after CEO Howard Lutnick sat down (video) with Jim Cramer on Mad Money last night. Potential investors got an earful on the company's lush 9.6% yield and growth prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 2 Comments
  • ANN

    Clothing retailer Ann Inc. (ANN +4.2%) gains after SunTrust Robinson Humphrey raises its rating...

    Clothing retailer Ann Inc. (ANN +4.2%) gains after SunTrust Robinson Humphrey raises its rating to Buy. SunTrust says it sees the company's year-end conference call next week as a positive catalyst for the stock, noting its aggressive promotional activity, a pick-up in Q1 sales and clean inventory levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • RAD

    Susquehanna is out with a take that Rite Aid (RAD +5.1%) makes for an attractive target for...

    Susquehanna is out with a take that Rite Aid (RAD +5.1%) makes for an attractive target for Walgreen (WAG +0.3%) after reading the tea leaves on Rite Aid's rescheduled same-store sales release and restructured compensation arrangement, along with a ESRX-MHS deal that's weighing heavy on Walgreen.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-IO (FIO +6.4%) continues its recent run after Morgan Stanley’s Katy Huberty...

    Fusion-IO (FIO +6.4%) continues its recent run after Morgan Stanley’s Katy Huberty reinstates coverage at Buy, writing that its overall market for enterprise flash storage equipment could rise from $2B at present to $20B “over time.” "Over half of FIO’s customers are using its products for persistent storage in scale-out environments,” Huberty says, which demonstrate strong customer relationships.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • ELON

    Smart meter developer Echelon (ELON +6.3%) pops after Piper upgrades shares to Overweight,...

    Smart meter developer Echelon (ELON +6.3%) pops after Piper upgrades shares to Overweight, following meetings with Brazilian partner ELO (uses Echelon's technology for its own smart meters) and electricity regulator ANEEL. The firm thinks Brazil could represent a $1.5B opportunity for Echelon, assuming all of the country's traditional meters are replaced, and ELO can maintain its 50% local smart meter share.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6.3%) says it has accepted (8-K) the terms and conditions of the Macau...

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6.3%) says it has accepted (8-K) the terms and conditions of the Macau government that will allow the building of a 5-star resort on the Cotai Strip. There are rumors the SEC filing was made in error. The shares remain halted from trade. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • ESL

    Esterline Technologies (ESL +8.2%) trades higher despite posting a mixed FQ1 late yesterday....

    Esterline Technologies (ESL +8.2%) trades higher despite posting a mixed FQ1 late yesterday. Revenue rose 27% Y/Y, masking a drop in net profit as costs from a recently acquired business offset stronger sales from the company's commercial aerospace business. The company also raised its full-year earnings guidance, saying the aerospace sector continues to benefit from robust demand. It now expects to earn between $5.10 - 5.40 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6.3%) is halted, with word about it has gotten a land concession necessary...

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN +6.3%) is halted, with word about it has gotten a land concession necessary to build another resort in Macau.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +8.2%) rallies strongly for the second day following the release of Zynga Platform...

    Zynga (ZNGA +8.2%) rallies strongly for the second day following the release of Zynga Platform (I, II), as investors weigh the potential implications if Zynga can break free of its dependence on Facebook. Eric Volkman suggests Zynga Platform could make the company "the Electronic Arts and Activision combined of low-cost, mobile/social network gaming," but adds plenty of hurdles remain.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide (MWW -2.4%) dips on a downgrade to Neutral at UBS, citing domestic share...

    Monster Worldwide (MWW -2.4%) dips on a downgrade to Neutral at UBS, citing domestic share losses, slowing international growth, and increased competition.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • RENN

    Renren (RENN +7.8%) shares pop after announcing its social networking application is the first...

    Renren (RENN +7.8%) shares pop after announcing its social networking application is the first of its kind selected for Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) Windows 8 app store. "Renren HD has adopted features such as tiled Metro-style user interfaces and creative content delivery, resulting in a significantly enhanced user experience," RENN says.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • SINA

    A number of Chinese Internet stocks are spiking higher today, following a rally for the Shanghai...

    A number of Chinese Internet stocks are spiking higher today, following a rally for the Shanghai exchange. SINA +8.5%. YOKU +5.3%. RENN +8.6%. TUDO +2.5%. SOHU +4.6%.  PWRD +2.5%. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 2 Comments
  • OMG

    Shares of OM Group (OMG -3.3%) taper off after KeyBanc takes its rating down to Hold from Buy...

    Shares of OM Group (OMG -3.3%) taper off after KeyBanc takes its rating down to Hold from Buy after it missed earnings estimates earlier this week. An analyst with KeyBanc says that although shares are attractive on several metrics, falling cobalt prices and a challenging H1 outlook stand in the way of near-term potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • YELP

    Yelp (NYSE:YELP) opened for trading at $22.01, and is now changing hands at $24.51, up 63% from...

    Yelp (NYSE:YELP) opened for trading at $22.01, and is now changing hands at $24.51, up 63% from its $15 IPO price. (S-1 filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 2 Comments
  • TPC

    Tutor Perini (TPC -9%) shares sink after missing its Q4 earnings number and guiding 2012 EPS...

    Tutor Perini (TPC -9%) shares sink after missing its Q4 earnings number and guiding 2012 EPS below consensus. Projected 2012 EPS of $2.10-$2.30 on revenue of $4.5-$5B would compare with TPC’s profit of $1.80/share on revenue of $3.72B for 2011. Backlog of uncompleted construction work as of Dec. 31 stood at $6.1B, vs. $4.3B at year-end 2010.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • SYNC

    Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC), which went public 3 weeks ago, is up 5.2% after announcing its software...

    Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC), which went public 3 weeks ago, is up 5.2% after announcing its software will be used to deliver Turner Broadcasting's (NYSE:TWX) online NCAA Tournament streams to authorized pay-TV customers. Synacor's software already helps enable a number of TV Everywhere initiatives.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) +3.7% premarket after popular China search engine Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) says it...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) +3.7% premarket after popular China search engine Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) says it will begin to display real-time links to tweets on Sina-run microblogs. Baidu boasts ~80% of the China search market, and Sina's Weibo has ~65% of the microblogging market. Baidu users also will be able to search for posts on microblogs of Sohu.com (NASDAQ:SOHU), NetEase.com (NASDAQ:NTES) and Tencent.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • FL

    Innovative apparel and footwear merchandise helped Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) report higher...

    Innovative apparel and footwear merchandise helped Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) report higher same-store sales and expanding margins in Q4, pushing earnings past Wall Street estimates. But shares -2.1% premarket on expectations same-store sales would have risen even higher than the reported 7.5% increase.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • OSTK

    More on Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) (previous): The company says that Q4 revenues were adversely...

    More on Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) (previous): The company says that Q4 revenues were adversely impacted by both a search engine ranking "penalty" from Google that dropped its ranking in organic search results significantly and from a rebranding plan that went awry by confusing customers. Separately, it discloses in a 10-K filed with the SEC that it faces a patent infringement lawsuit in Texas from H-W Technology over Internet Protocol Phone technology. Shares have resumed trading off a trading halt, down 11.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) +14.5% premarket after acquiring Kodak's (EKDKQ.PK) Gallery online...

    Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) +14.5% premarket after acquiring Kodak's (EKDKQ.PK) Gallery online photo business. Jefferies reiterates its Buy rating and $30 price target on SFLY, saying "the deal should solidify the company's position further as the leader in online print, and present a number of opportunities for revenue and cost synergies over time."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM
  • SCLN

    SciClone Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SCLN) trades 10.7% lower premarket after the firm announces...

    SciClone Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SCLN) trades 10.7% lower premarket after the firm announces that its SCV-07 drug candidate failed to meet efficacy endpoints.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM
  • BIOF

    Shares of BioFuel Energy (NASDAQ:BIOF) catapult 24.1% higher in premarket trading after the firm...

    Shares of BioFuel Energy (NASDAQ:BIOF) catapult 24.1% higher in premarket trading after the firm reports that it turned a Q4 profit on revenue of $164M (+15.9% Y/Y). The company says that it anticipates seasonal factors will bring in more favorable margins in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM | 2 Comments
  • BCS

    Barclays (NYSE:BCS) tapped LTRO II for €8.2B, an unexpected move as it had indicated it had...

    Barclays (NYSE:BCS) tapped LTRO II for €8.2B, an unexpected move as it had indicated it had no plans to take any funds and didn't take any cash at the previous offer in December. Barclays says it will use the money to manage funding gaps in Spain and Portugal. Premarket: BCS +1.9%, and +3.2% in London.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 AM | 1 Comment
